lead_paragraph: The San Francisco 49ers lost twice with linebacker Lance Briggs, failing to sign him in free agency and forfeiting their fifth-round draft pick in next month’s draft after N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell determined Monday that the Niners had tampered with Briggs, a violation of league rules. The 49ers and the Bears will also exchange their picks in the third round, giving the Bears San Francisco’s seventh pick, while the Niners will get the Bears’ pick at No. 12. Briggs was with the Bears last season when reports surfaced that the 49ers had had contact with Briggs’s agent, Drew Rosenhaus. The Bears had made Briggs their franchise player in 2007, and Briggs, who was angered by the move, stated he would not return to the Bears after he played out his one-year contract. But Briggs re-signed with the Bears this month. In the meantime, the Bears filed a tampering charge with the league.
